Detailed Description

This class represents a method declaration in a TinyJava class.

A method declaration is represented by:

  • the method name (a string)
  • whether the method public or not
  • the return type of the method (an integer value, as defined in the AstNode class)
  • formal parameters of the method (Declaration pointers)
  • local variables of the method (Declaration pointers)
  • body of the method (a pointer to a Statement)

A pointer to the symbol table ENTRY for the method may also be included.

ENTRY should be defined as a macro, and its value should be a class, which is the root of the symbol table entry hierarchy. Its default value is Entry. The macro should be defined at the beginning of the header file Ast.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

MethodDeclaration::MethodDeclaration ( int  lno,
const char *  nm,
int  rt 
)

Create a new MethodDeclaration object. The method body is set to NULL. The symbol table ENTRY pointer is set to NULL. No parameters or local variables are created.

Parameters:
lno a source code line number with the method declaration (should be the beginning of the method)
nm a string representing the method name
rt a integer value representing the return type, as defined in the AstNode class
Exceptions:
AstException if the method name is NULL

aVisitor is a visitor object of type AstVisitor.

Implements AstNode.

Return the body of this method

Returns:
pointer to a Statement representing the body of the method
ENTRY* MethodDeclaration::getEntry (  )  [inline]

Return a pointer to the symbol table ENTRY representing this method declaration. This value may be undefined before the symbol table is created.

Returns:
a pointer to the symbol table entry representing this method declaration.
const char* MethodDeclaration::getName (  )  [inline]

Return the method name.

Returns:
string representing the method name.
std::vector<Declaration *>* MethodDeclaration::getParameters (  )  [inline]

Return all formal parameters of this method.

Returns:
a pointer to a std::vector with pointers referencing ParameterDeclarations of this method
int MethodDeclaration::getRetType (  )  [inline]

Return the type of this method declaration node.

Returns:
an integer value representing the method return type, as defined in the AstNode class.
std::vector<Declaration *>* MethodDeclaration::getVariables (  )  [inline]

Return all local variables of this method.

Returns:
a pointer to a std::vector with pointers referencing VariableDeclarations of this method
bool MethodDeclaration::isPublicMethod (  )  [inline]

Is the method public?

Returns:
a boolean value representing the method's public visibility status
void MethodDeclaration::setBody ( Statement *  b  )  [inline]

Set the body of thie method

Parameters:
b a Statement pointer representing the body of the method; must be a pointer to BlockStatement
Exceptions:
AstException if the argument b is NULL or if it is not a BlockStatement
void MethodDeclaration::setEntry ( ENTRY *  e  )  [inline]

Set the pointer to the symbol table entry representing this method declaration. This value will typically be set during the symbol table construction phase.

Parameters:
e the pointer to the symbol table entry representing this method declaration.
void MethodDeclaration::setParameters ( std::vector< Declaration * > *  ps  ) 

Set the formal parameters of this method declaration

Parameters:
ps a pointer to a std::vector of ParameterDeclaration pointers, each representing a formal parameter declaration
Exceptions:
AstException if any of the Declaration pointers in the argument std::vector is NULL or is not a ParameterDeclaration
void MethodDeclaration::setPublicMethod ( bool  isPubliclyVisible  )  [inline]

Set the public visibility status of this method

Parameters:
isPubliclyVisible the new public visibility status
void MethodDeclaration::setVariables ( std::vector< Declaration * > *  vs  ) 

Set the local variables of this method declaration

Parameters:
vs a pointer to a std::vector of VariableDeclaration pointers, each representing a local variable declaration
Exceptions:
AstException if any of the Declaration pointers in the argument std::vector is NULL or is not a VariableDeclaration
